items.descriptor: Evaluate how engineering practices support speed, quality, and sustainable delivery
items.raw: Technical Agility Maturity Evaluate how engineering practices support speed, quality, and sustainable delivery

entries.descriptor: Engineering practices are ad hoc with minimal emphasis on testing, automation, or code quality.
Technical debt is unmanaged and regularly impedes progress.
Basic CI/CD pipelines are in place, but not consistently used or trusted.
Teams have begun writing unit tests but coverage and reliability are low.
Code is peer-reviewed, version-controlled, and integrated daily through automated builds.
CI/CD pipelines enforce gating criteria and provide fast feedback on integration issues.
Teams track and reduce technical debt through prioritized backlog items.
Infrastructure as Code and automated testing enable frequent, reliable deployments.
Engineering teams use telemetry, monitoring, and alerts to identify and resolve issues rapidly.
Technical practices are continuously improved through retrospectives, learning sessions, and experimentation.

yesNoInProgress.meta-description: Three options to determine if an action is not started, in progress, or completed
